title-group.article-title: Faster Adaptive Importance Sampling in Low Dimensions

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1998 American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

abstract.p: Adaptive importance sampling using kernel density estimation techniques was introduced by West. This technique adapts the importance sampling function to the underlying integrand, thus yielding small-variance estimates. One drawback of this approach is that evaluation of the kernel mixture density is slow. We present a linear tensor spline representation of the adaptive importance function using variable bandwidth kernels that retains the small variance properties of West's approach but executes more quickly.
